channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The largest Fortune 500 company has 2 million employees. These 8 have under 2,000
item.description: These small but mighty companies on the Fortune 500 raked in more than $87 billion in combined revenue over the past year.

item.title: Ukraine and Russia to Meet for Second Round of Talks
item.description: After more than three years of war, Russia and Ukraine are engaged in direct and public talks to end the fighting, but their positions remain far apar...

item.title: Women run 11% of Fortune 500 companies in 2025—but progress is still slow
item.description: Fifty-five Fortune 500 companies are led by women CEOs this year.

item.title: This little-known AI darling is climbing the Fortune 500 faster than any other company
item.description: Super Micro Computer skyrocketed 206 spots on the Fortune 500, thanks to its pivotal role in powering the AI boom.

item.title: A Giant Plume of Saharan Dust Is Headed to Florida
item.description: Dust carried across the Atlantic is one of the great wonders of the weather world. This is the most significant cloud so far this year.

item.title: What to Know About the Russia-Ukraine Cease-Fire Talks
item.description: The two sides are meeting on Monday in Istanbul, but expectations for a breakthrough are low.

item.title: A Man Attacked a March for Israeli Hostages in Colorado. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: Eight people were hospitalized after a man used a “makeshift flamethrower” on a gathering in Boulder, Colo., honoring Israeli captives in Gaza. The au...

item.title: ‘Targeted Terror Attack’ in Colorado, and Ukraine’s Audacious Plot
item.description: Plus, the oldest corporation on the continent is closing.

item.title: AI-built startups could fuel increase in venture capital ‘zombie’ funds
item.description: The number of zombie VC funds has jumped by 50% since the end of 2021.

item.title: As boomers are forced to ‘unretire’ because they’ve not saved enough, 6-year-olds in Germany could soon have retirement accounts
item.description: Millions of baby boomers can't afford to retire. It’s a fate that Gen Alpha in Germany may never have to face under new plans.

item.title: Poland Elects Karol Nawrocki as President
item.description: The victory of Karol Nawrocki, who is backed by the previous right-wing governing party, will complicate Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s efforts to advan...

item.title: Bangladesh’s Ousted Leader Sheikh Hasina Faces New Arrest Warrant
item.description: The war crimes tribunal that Sheikh Hasina herself founded has now charged her in the crackdown that killed more than a thousand demonstrators.

item.title: The Imports the U.S. Relies On Most From 140 Nations, From Albania to Zimbabwe
item.description: A look at the item from each country that makes up the largest American import share.

item.title: Ukraine and Russia to Meet for Second Round of Talks
item.description: After more than three years of war, Russia and Ukraine are engaged in direct and public talks to end the fighting, but their positions remain far apar...

item.title: U.K. to Build Up to 12 Submarines as Part of Shift to ‘War-Fighting Readiness’
item.description: Amid rising global tensions, Prime Minister Keir Starmer outlined rearmament plans aimed at deterring an increasingly hostile Russia.
